snippet: Running back Chris Johnson, signed on Wednesday, laughed on Thursday when told of the ESPN report and said he would not have passed his physical if the Jets had any concerns.
abstract: Chris Johnson, signed by the New York Jets to be the breakaway runner they lacked, disputes an ESPN report that he has developed arthritis in his surgically repaired right knee; expresses confidence that he will be able to participate fully once training camp begins.
lead_paragraph: Running back Chris Johnson, signed on Wednesday, laughed on Thursday when told of the ESPN report and said he would not have passed his physical if the Jets had any concerns.

headline.main: Jets’ Newly Signed Running Back Denies Report That His Injured Knee Is Arthritic
headline.print_headline: Jets’ Newly Signed Running Back Denies Report That His Injured Knee Is Arthritic
